channel.title: Apache vhosts
channel.description:
I wanna set an entire domain to one root directory, that is every subdomain under that domain.
[code]<VirtualHost *:80> ServerName *.abc123.com DocumentRoot /opt/lampp/htdocs/www.abc123.com </VirtualHost>[/code]
Like that. But it doesn't work :(

item.title: Apache vhosts
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:318737”]Is the DNS set up correctly?

Also, why use VHosts at all, in this case? Do you have other domains on the box?[/quote]

Yes I’m hosting loads of domains. I’ve done it now anyway, this can be closed.

I had to use ServerAlias *.abc123.com as well as ServerName abc123.com

Read full topic

item.title: Apache vhosts
